timeline.message:
bugfix 'return void' in XbaseInterpreter

Signed-off-by: Andreas Heiduk <asheiduk@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: wonder if this is a regression in internalEvaluate
timeline.author: cdietrich

replies.bodyText: and or if we should have an elseif for Null/Void in  org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.interpreter.impl.XbaseInterpreter.doEvaluate(XExpression, IEvaluationContext, CancelIndicator)
replies.author: cdietrich

replies.bodyText:
wonder if we should add a testcase to
AbstractXbaseEvaluationTest / XbaseInterpreterTest

Yes, that would be necessary. Xbase does not allow to define methods though the tests should be based on lambda expressions with a procedural type, e.g. val Runnable r = [ return; ]; r.run()
replies.author: szarnekow

replies.bodyText: I don't think it's a regression. Looks like it was an incomplete solution since 2011
replies.author: szarnekow

replies.bodyText:
an elseif for Null/Void in org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.interpreter.impl.XbaseInterpreter.doEvaluate

No, I don't think so. A null expression would be a programming error which is already indicated by the IllegalArgumentException.
replies.author: szarnekow
